Therefore, there is very weak feedback from the condition of the resource to the decisions of the resource users. The consequence is overuse of the resource, eroding it until it becomes unavailable to anyone.

陷阱：当资源被共享时，每个用户都能直接从中受益，但同时也要与其他用户共同承担滥用资源的代价。因此，资源状况对用户决策的反馈非常薄弱。其结果是资源被过度使用，最终导致资源枯竭，无人可用。

The Way Out : Educate and exhort the users, so they understand the consequences of abusing the resource. And also restore or strengthen the missing feedback link, either by privatizing the resource so each user feels the direct consequences of its abuse or (since many resources cannot be privatized) by regulating the access of all users to the resource.

解决之道：教育并劝导用户，让他们了解滥用资源的后果。同时，恢复或加强缺失的反馈机制，可以通过两种方式实现：一是将资源私有化，让每个用户都能直接感受到滥用的后果；二是（由于许多资源无法私有化）限制所有用户对资源的访问权限。

Drift to Low Performance

性能下降

Trap : Allowing performance standards to be influenced by past performance, especially if there is a negative bias in perceiving past performance, sets up a reinforcing feedback loop of eroding goals that sets a system drifting toward low performance.

陷阱：允许绩效标准受到过去绩效的影响，尤其是在对过去绩效存在负面偏见的情况下，会形成一个强化反馈循环，导致目标不断削弱，使系统滑向低绩效。

The Way Out : Keep performance standards absolute. Even better, let standards be enhanced by the best actual performances instead of being discouraged by the worst. Set up a drift toward high performance!

出路：保持绩效标准的绝对性。更理想的做法是，让最佳的实际表现提升标准，而不是让最差的表现打击士气。引导大家朝着高绩效迈进！

Escalation

升级

Trap : When the state of one stock is determined by trying to surpass the state of another stock—and vice versa—then there is a reinforcing feedback loop carrying the system into an arms race, a wealth race, a smear campaign, escalating loudness, escalating violence. The escalation is exponential and can lead to extremes surprisingly quickly. If nothing is done, the spiral will be stopped by someone’s collapse—because exponential growth cannot go on forever.

陷阱：当一只股票的走势取决于它试图超越另一只股票的走势——反之亦然——就会形成一种强化反馈循环，将系统推向军备竞赛、财富竞赛、抹黑运动、不断升级的喧嚣和暴力。这种升级呈指数级增长，并可能以惊人的速度导致极端局面。如果不采取任何措施，这种螺旋式增长最终会因某只股票的崩盘而停止——因为指数级增长不可能永远持续下去。

The Way Out : The best way out of this trap is to avoid getting in it. If caught in an escalating system, one can refuse to compete (unilaterally disarm), thereby interrupting the reinforcing loop. Or one can negotiate a new system with balancing loops to control the escalation.

出路：摆脱这种陷阱的最佳方法就是避免落入其中。如果陷入不断升级的体系，可以拒绝竞争（单方面解除武装），从而中断强化循环。或者，也可以协商建立一个带有平衡机制的新体系来控制事态升级。

Success to the Successful

祝成功者成功

Trap : If the winners of a competition are systematically rewarded with the means to win again, a reinforcing feedback loop is created by which, if it is allowed to proceed uninhibited, the winners eventually take all, while the losers are eliminated.

陷阱：如果比赛的获胜者被系统性地奖励以再次获胜的手段，就会形成一个强化反馈回路，如果任其不受限制地进行，最终获胜者将获得一切，而失败者将被淘汰。

The Way Out : Diversification, which allows those who are losing the competition to get out of that game and start another one; strict limitation on the fraction of the pie any one winner may win (antitrust laws); policies that level the playing field, removing some of the advantage of the strongest players or increasing the advantage of the weakest; policies that devise rewards for success that do not bias the next round of competition.

出路：多元化经营，让那些在竞争中失败的人退出当前的游戏，开始另一场游戏；严格限制任何一个赢家可以赢得的蛋糕份额（反垄断法）；制定公平竞争环境的政策，消除强者的一些优势或增加弱者的优势；制定奖励成功的政策，但这些政策不会对下一轮竞争产生偏见。

Shifting the Burden to the Intervenor

将负担转移给干预者

Trap : Shifting the burden, dependence, and addiction arise when a solution to a systemic problem reduces (or disguises) the symptoms, but does nothing to solve the underlying problem. Whether it is a substance that dulls one’s perception or a policy that hides the underlying trouble, the drug of choice interferes with the actions that could solve the real problem.

陷阱：当系统性问题的解决方案仅仅减轻（或掩盖）了症状，却未能解决根本问题时，就会出现负担转移、依赖和成瘾现象。无论是麻痹感知能力的物质，还是掩盖潜在问题的政策，人们选择的“药物”都会阻碍那些本可以解决真正问题的行动。

If the intervention designed to correct the problem causes the self-maintaining capacity of the original system to atrophy or erode, then a destructive reinforcing feedback loop is set in motion. The system deteriorates; more and more of the solution is then required. The system will become more and more dependent on the intervention and less and less able to maintain its own desired state.

如果旨在纠正问题的干预措施导致原有系统的自我维持能力萎缩或削弱，就会启动一个破坏性的正反馈回路。系统恶化，需要越来越多的解决方案。系统将越来越依赖干预措施，越来越难以维持自身所需的理想状态。

The Way Out : Again, the best way out of this trap is to avoid getting in. Beware of symptom-relieving or signal-denying policies or practices that don’t really address the problem. Take the focus off short-term relief and put it on long term restructuring.

出路：再次强调，摆脱这种困境的最佳方法就是避免落入其中。警惕那些只能缓解症状或掩盖问题的政策或做法，它们并不能真正解决问题。不要只关注短期缓解，而应着眼于长期重组。

If you are the intervenor, work in such a way as to restore or enhance the system’s own ability to solve its problems, then remove yourself.

如果你是干预者，那就努力恢复或增强系统自身解决问题的能力，然后退出。

If you are the one with an unsupportable dependency, build your system’s own capabilities back up before removing the intervention. Do it right away. The longer you wait, the harder the withdrawal process will be.

如果你已经对某种东西产生了无法承受的依赖，那么在移除这种依赖之前，务必先重建自身系统的能力。而且要立即行动。拖得越久，戒断过程就越困难。

Rule Beating

违反规则

Trap : Rules to govern a system can lead to rule-beating—perverse behavior that gives the appearance of obeying the rules or achieving the goals, but that actually distorts the system.

陷阱：管理系统的规则可能会导致违规行为——这种反常行为表面上是在遵守规则或实现目标，但实际上却扭曲了系统。

The Way Out : Design, or redesign, rules to release creativity not in the direction of beating the rules, but in the direction of achieving the purpose of the rules.

出路：设计或重新设计规则，以释放创造力，不是为了让创造力去违反规则，而是为了让创造力去实现规则的目的。

Seeking the Wrong Goal

追求错误的目标

Trap : System behavior is particularly sensitive to the goals of feedback loops. If the goals—the indicators of satisfaction of the rules—are defined inaccurately or incompletely, the system may obediently work to produce a result that is not really intended or wanted.

陷阱：系统行为对反馈回路的目标尤为敏感。如果目标（即规则满足程度的指标）定义不准确或不完整，系统可能会盲目地产生并非真正预期或期望的结果。

The Way Out : Specify indicators and goals that reflect the real welfare of the system. Be especially careful not to confuse effort with result or you will end up with a system that is producing effort, not result.

出路：明确能够反映系统真实状况的指标和目标。尤其要注意不要将努力与结果混淆，否则最终得到的系统只会产生努力，而不会产生结果。

Places to Intervene in a System (in increasing order of effectiveness)

系统中可干预的方面（按有效性递增顺序排列）

12. Numbers: Constants and parameters such as subsidies, taxes, and standards

12. 数字：诸如补贴、税收和标准之类的常量和参数

11. Buffers: The sizes of stabilizing stocks relative to their flows

11. 缓冲：稳定库存相对于其流量的大小

10. Stock-and-Flow Structures: Physical systems and their nodes of intersection

10. 存量流量结构：物理系统及其交汇节点

9. Delays: The lengths of time relative to the rates of system changes

9. 延迟：相对于系统变化速率的时间长度

8. Balancing Feedback Loops: The strength of the feedbacks relative to the impacts they are trying to correct

8. 平衡反馈回路：反馈的强度相对于其试图纠正的影响而言是否合适。

7. Reinforcing Feedback Loops: The strength of the gain of driving loops

7. 增强反馈回路：驱动回路增益的强度

6. Information Flows: The structure of who does and does not have access to information

6. 信息流：谁能获取信息以及谁不能获取信息的结构

5. Rules: Incentives, punishments, constraints 4. Self-Organization: The power to add, change, or evolve system structure

5. 规则：激励、惩罚、约束 4. 自组织：系统结构增加、改变或演化的能力

3. Goals: The purpose of the system

3. 目标：系统的目的

2. Paradigms: The mind-set out of which the system—its goals, structure, rules, delays, parameters—arises

2. 范式：系统（包括其目标、结构、规则、延迟和参数）产生的思维模式

1. Transcending Paradigms

1. 超越范式

Guidelines for Living in a World of Systems

在系统世界中生活的指南

1. Get the beat of the system.

1. 掌握系统的运行规律。

2. Expose your mental models to the light of day.

2. 将你的思维模型暴露在阳光下。

3. Honor, respect, and distribute information.

3. 尊重、重视并传播信息。

4. Use language with care and enrich it with systems concepts.

4. 谨慎使用语言，并用系统概念丰富语言内容。

5. Pay attention to what is important, not just what is quantifiable.

5. 关注重要的事情，而不仅仅是可量化的事情。

6. Make feedback policies for feedback systems.

6. 为反馈系统制定反馈政策。

7. Go for the good of the whole.

7. 为整体利益着想。

8. Listen to the wisdom of the system.

8. 听从制度的智慧。

9. Locate responsibility within the system.

9. 确定系统内的责任方。

10. Stay humble—stay a learner.

10. 保持谦逊，保持学习的态度。

11. Celebrate complexity.

11. 拥抱复杂性。

12. Expand time horizons.

12. 拓宽时间视野。

13. Defy the disciplines.

13. 违抗纪律。

14. Expand the boundary of caring.

14. 扩大关怀的边界。

15. Don’t erode the goal of goodness.

15. 不要削弱行善的目标。

Model Equations

模型方程

There is much to be learned about systems without using a computer. However, once you have started to explore the behavior of even very simple systems, you may well find that you wish to learn more about building your own formal mathematical models of systems. The models in this book were originally developed using STELLA modeling software, by isee systems Inc. (formerly High Performance Systems). The equations in this section are written to be easily translated into various modeling software, such as Vensim by Ventana Systems Inc. as well as STELLA and iThink by isee systems Inc.

即使不使用计算机，我们也能学到很多关于系统的知识。然而，一旦你开始探索哪怕是非常简单的系统的行为，你很可能会发现自己想要学习如何构建自己的系统正式数学模型。本书中的模型最初是使用isee systems Inc.（前身为High Performance Systems）的STELLA建模软件开发的。本节中的方程式编写得便于转换成各种建模软件，例如Ventana Systems Inc.的Vensim以及isee systems Inc.的STELLA和iThink。

The following model equations are those used for the nine dynamic models discussed in chapters 1 and 2. “Converters” can be constants or calculations based on other elements of the system model. Time is abbreviated ( t ) and the change in time from one calculation to the next, the time interval, is noted as ( dt ).

以下模型方程用于第 1 章和第 2 章讨论的九个动态模型。“转换器”可以是常数，也可以是基于系统模型其他元素的计算值。时间缩写为 (t)，从一次计算到下一次计算的时间变化，即时间间隔，记为 (dt)。

Chapter One

第一章

Bathtub —for Figures 5, 6 and 7

浴缸——适用于图 5、图 6 和图 7

Stock: water in tub(t) = water in tub(t – dt) + (inflow – outflow) × dt Initial stock value: water in tub = 50 gal

存水量：浴缸中水量(t) = 浴缸中水量(t – dt) + (流入量 – 流出量) × dt 初始存水量：浴缸中水量 = 50 加仑

t = minutes

t = 分钟

dt = 1 minute

dt = 1 分钟

Run time = 10 minutes

运行时间 = 10 分钟

Inflow: inflow = 0 gal/min . . . for time 0 to 5; 5 gal/min . . . for time 6 to 10

进水量：进水量 = 0 加仑/分钟（时间 0 至 5）；进水量 = 5 加仑/分钟（时间 6 至 10）

Outflow: outflow = 5 gal/min

出流量：出流量 = 5 加仑/分钟

Coffee Cup Cooling or Warming —for Figures 10 and 11

咖啡杯冷却或加热——参见图 10 和图 11

Cooling

冷却

Stock: coffee temperature(t) = coffee temperature (t – dt) – (cooling × dt) Initial stock value: coffee temperature = 100°C, 80°C, and 60°C . . . for three comparative model runs.

库存：咖啡温度(t) = 咖啡温度(t – dt) – (冷却 × dt) 初始库存值：咖啡温度 = 100°C、80°C 和 60°C . . . ，用于三个对比模型运行。

t = minutes

t = 分钟

dt = 1 minute

dt = 1 分钟

Run time = 8 minutes

运行时间 = 8 分钟

Outflow: cooling = discrepancy × 10%

出流量：冷却量 = 差值 × 10%

Converters: discrepancy = coffee temperature – room temperature room temperature = 18°C

换算：温差 = 咖啡温度 – 室温 室温 = 18°C

Warming

变暖

Stock: coffee temperature(t) = coffee temperature(t – dt) + (heating × dt)

库存：咖啡温度(t) = 咖啡温度(t – dt) + (加热 × dt)

Initial stock value: coffee temperature = 0°C, 5°C, and 10°C . . . for three comparative model runs.

初始库存值：咖啡温度 = 0°C、5°C 和 10°C . . . ，用于三个对比模型运行。

t = minutes

t = 分钟

dt = 1 minute

dt = 1 分钟

Run time = 8 minutes

运行时间 = 8 分钟

Inflow: heating = discrepancy × 10%

流入量：加热量 = 偏差 × 10%

Converters: discrepancy = room temperature – coffee temperature room temperature = 18°C

换算：温差 = 室温 – 咖啡温度 室温 = 18°C

Bank Account —for Figures 12 and 13

银行账户——用于图 12 和图 13

Stock: money in bank account(t) = money in bank account(t – dt) + (interest added × dt)

存量：银行账户余额(t) = 银行账户余额(t – dt) + (利息增加量 × dt)

Initial stock value: money in bank account = $100

初始股票价值：银行账户余额 = 100 美元

t = years dt = 1 year

t = 年，dt = 1 年

Run time = 12 years

运行时间 = 12 年

Inflow: interest added ($/year) = money in bank account × interest rate

流入：利息收入（美元/年）= 银行账户余额 × 利率

Converter: interest rate = 2%, 4%, 6%, 8%, & 10% annual interest . . . for five comparative model runs.

转换器：年利率分别为 2%、4%、6%、8% 和 10%……共进行了五次对比模型运行。

Chapter Two

第二章

Thermostat —For Figures 14–20

恒温器——参见图 14–20

Stock: room temperature(t) = room temperature(t – dt) + (heat from furnace – heat to outside) × dt

库存：室温(t) = 室温(t – dt) + (炉内热量 – 向外散发的热量) × dt

Initial stock value: room temperature = 10°C for cold-room warming;

初始库存值：冷藏室升温时室温=10°C；

18°C for warm-room cooling

18°C 用于温暖房间的冷却

t = hours

t = 小时

dt = 1 hour

dt = 1 小时

Run time = 8 hours and 24 hours

运行时间 = 8 小时和 24 小时

Inflow: heat from furnace = minimum of discrepancy between desired and actual room temperature or 5

流入量：来自炉子的热量 = 所需室温与实际室温之间的最小偏差或 5

Outflow: heat to outside = discrepancy between inside and outside temperature × 10% . . . for “normal” house; discrepancy between inside and outside temperature × 30% . . . for very leaky house

热量散失：散失到室外的热量 = 室内外温差 × 10%……适用于“普通”房屋；室内外温差 × 30%……适用于漏风严重的房屋

Converters: thermostat setting = 18°C discrepancy between desired and actual room temperature = maximum of ( thermostat setting – room temperature ) or 0 discrepancy between inside and outside temperature = room temperature – 10°C . . . for constant outside temperature (Figures 16–18); room temperature – 24-hour outside temp . . . for full day-and night cycle (Figures 19 and 20) 24-hour outside temp ranges from 10°C (50°F) during the day to – 5°C (23°F) at night, as shown in graph

换算关系：恒温器设定值 = 18°C；所需室温与实际室温之间的温差 = (恒温器设定值 – 室温) 或 0 中的较大值；室内外温差 = 室温 – 10°C……（室外温度恒定时，见图 16-18）；室温 – 24 小时室外温度……（昼夜循环时，见图 19 和 20）。如图所示，24 小时室外温度范围为白天 10°C (50°F) 至夜间 –5°C (23°F)。

Population —for Figures 21–26

人口——图 21–26

Stock: population(t) = population(t – dt) + ( births – deaths ) × dt Initial stock value: population = 6.6 billion people

存量：人口(t) = 人口(t – dt) + (出生数 – 死亡数) × dt 初始存量：人口 = 66亿人

t = years

t = 年

dt = 1 year

dt = 1 年

Run time = 100 years

运行时间 = 100 年

Inflow: births = population × fertility

流入量：出生率 = 人口数 × 生育率

Outflow: deaths = population × mortality
流出量：死亡人数 = 人口数 × 死亡率


Converters:
转换器：

Figure 22:

图 22：

mortality = .009 . . . or 9 deaths per 1000 population

死亡率 = 0.009……或每千人中有 9 人死亡

fertility = .021 . . . or 21 births per 1000 population

生育率 = 0.021，即每千人中有 21 个新生儿

Figure 23:

图 23：

mortality = .030

死亡率 = 0.030

fertility = .021

生育率 = 0.021

Figure 24:

图 24：

mortality = .009

死亡率 = 0.009

fertility starts at .021 and falls over time to .009 as shown in graph

如图所示，生育力初始值为 0.021，并随时间推移下降至 0.009。

Figure 26:

图 26：

mortality = .009

死亡率 = 0.009

fertility starts at .021, drops to .009, but then rises .030 as shown in graph

如图所示，生育率初始值为 0.021，下降至 0.009，然后上升至 0.030。

Capital —for Figures 27 and 28

资本——用于图 27 和图 28

Stock: capital stock(t) = capital stock(t – dt) + ( investment – depreciation ) × dt Initial stock value: capital stock = 100

存量：资本存量(t) = 资本存量(t – dt) + (投资 – 折旧) × dt 初始存量：资本存量 = 100

t = years

t = 年

dt = 1 year

dt = 1 年

Run time = 50 years

运行时间 = 50 年

Inflow: investment = annual output × investment fraction

流入：投资 = 年产出 × 投资率

Outflow: depreciation = capital stock / capital lifetime

支出：折旧 = 资本存量 / 资本寿命

Converters: annual output = capital stock × output per unit capital capital lifetime = 10 years, 15 years, and 20 years . . . for three comparative model runs.

转换器：年产出 = 资本存量 × 单位资本产出 资本寿命 = 10 年、15 年和 20 年……，用于三个比较模型运行。

investment fraction = 20%

投资比例 = 20%

output per unit capital = 1/3

单位资本产出 = 1/3

Business Inventory —for Figures 29–36

企业库存——图 29–36

Stock: inventory of cars on the lot(t) = inventory of cars on the lot(t – dt) + ( deliveries – sales ) × dt Initial stock values: inventory of cars on the lot = 200 cars

库存：停车场内车辆存量(t) = 停车场内车辆存量(t – dt) + (交付量 – 销售量) × dt 初始库存值：停车场内车辆存量 = 200 辆

t = days

t = 天

dt = 1 day

dt = 1 天

Run time = 100 days

运行时间 = 100 天

Inflows: deliveries = 20 . . . for time 0 to 5; orders to factory (t – delivery delay) . . . for time 6 to 100

流入量：交货量 = 20...，时间 0 至 5；工厂订单量（t - 交货延迟）...，时间 6 至 100

Outflows: sales = minimum of inventory of cars on the lot or customer demand

支出：销售额 = 停车场内车辆库存最低值或客户需求

Converters: customer demand = 20 cars per day . . . for time 0 to 25; 22 cars per day . . . for time 26 to 100

转换器：客户需求 = 每天 20 辆车……时间 0 到 25；每天 22 辆车……时间 26 到 100

perceived sales = sales averaged over perception delay (i.e., sales smoothed over perception delay )

感知销售额 = 感知延迟后的平均销售额（即，根据感知延迟平滑后的销售额）

desired inventory = perceived sales × 10

理想库存量 = 预期销量 × 10

discrepancy = desired inventory – inventory of cars on the lot

差异 = 预期库存 – 停车场内车辆库存

orders to factory = maximum of ( perceived sales + discrepancy ) or 0 . . . for

工厂订单量 = （预期销售额 + 差异）或 0 中的较大值……

Figure 32; maximum of ( perceived sales + discrepancy / response delay ) or 0 . . . for Figures 34–36

图 32；（感知销售额 + 差异 / 响应延迟）或 0 的最大值，适用于图 34–36。

Delays, Figure 30:
延误，图 30：

perception delay = 0

感知延迟 = 0

response delay = 0

响应延迟 = 0

delivery delay = 0

交货延迟 = 0

Delays, Figure 32:

延误，图 32：

perception delay = 5 days

感知延迟 = 5 天

response delay = 3 days

回复延迟 = 3 天

delivery delay = 5 days

发货延迟 = 5 天

Delays, Figure 34:

延误，图 34：

perception delay = 2 days

感知延迟 = 2 天

response delay = 3 days

回复延迟 = 3 天

delivery delay = 5 days

发货延迟 = 5 天

Delays, Figure 35:

延误，图 35：

perception delay = 5 days

感知延迟 = 5 天

response delay = 2 days

响应延迟 = 2 天

delivery delay = 5 days

发货延迟 = 5 天

Delays, Figure 36:

延误，图 36：

perception delay = 5 days

感知延迟 = 5 天

response delay = 6 days

回复延迟 = 6 天

delivery delay = 5 days

发货延迟 = 5 天

A Renewable Stock Constrained by a Nonrenewable Resource —for Figures 37–41 Stock: resource(t) = resource(t – dt) – ( extraction × dt )

受不可再生资源约束的可再生资源存量——图 37–41 存量：资源(t) = 资源(t – dt) – (提取 × dt )

Initial stock values: resource = 1000 . . . for Figures 38, 40, and 41; 1000, 2000, and 4000 . . . for three comparative model runs in Figure 39 Outflow: extraction = capital × yield per unit capital

初始库存值：资源 = 1000……（图 38、40 和 41）；1000、2000 和 4000……（图 39 中的三个对比模型运行）。流出：提取量 = 资本 × 单位资本收益率

t = years

t = 年

dt = 1 year

dt = 1 年

Run time = 100 years

运行时间 = 100 年

Stock: capital(t) = capital(t – dt) + ( investment – depreciation ) × dt

存量：资本(t) = 资本(t – dt) + (投资 – 折旧) × dt

Initial stock values: capital = 5 Inflow: investment = minimum of profit or growth goal

初始股票价值：资本 = 5 资金流入：投资额 = 最低利润或增长目标

Outflow: depreciation = capital / capital lifetime

支出：折旧 = 资本 / 资本寿命

Converters: capital lifetime = 20 years

转换器：资本寿命 = 20 年

profit = ( price × extraction ) – ( capital × 10%) growth goal = capital × 10% . . .

利润 = （价格 × 开采量） - （资本 × 10%）增长目标 = 资本 × 10% . . .

for Figures 30–40; capital × 6%, 8%, 10%, and 12% . . . for four comparative model runs in Figure 40

图 30–40；资本分别乘以 6%、8%、10% 和 12%……图 40 中四个对比模型运行的结果

price = 3 . . . for Figures 38, 39, and 40; for Figure 41, price starts at 1.2

图 38、39 和 40 的价格为 3；图 41 的价格从 1.2 起。

when yield per unit capital is high and rises to 10 as yield per unit capital falls, as shown in graph

如图所示，当单位资本收益率较高时，收益率会上升至 10，而当单位资本收益率下降时，收益率则会上升至 10。

yield per unit capital starts at 1 when resource stock is high and falls to 0 as the resource stock declines, as shown in graph

如图所示，单位资本收益率在资源储量高时为 1，随着资源储量的下降而降至 0。

A Renewable Stock Constrained by a Renewable Resource —for Figures 42–45
受可再生资源约束的可再生存量——见图 42–45

Stock: resource(t) = resource(t – dt) + ( regeneration – harvest ) × dt

库存：资源(t) = 资源(t – dt) + (再生量 – 收获量) × dt

Initial stock value: resource = 1000

初始库存价值：资源 = 1000

Inflow: regeneration = resource × regeneration rate

流入量：再生量 = 资源 × 再生率

Outflow: harvest = capital × yield per unit capital

流出：收获 = 资本 × 单位资本收益率

t = years

t = 年

dt = 1 year

dt = 1 年

Run time = 100 years

运行时间 = 100 年

Stock: capital(t) = capital(t – dt) + ( investment – depreciation ) × dt

存量：资本(t) = 资本(t – dt) + (投资 – 折旧) × dt

Initial stock value: capital = 5

初始股票价值：资本 = 5

Inflow: investment = minimum of profit or growth goal

资金流入：投资额 = 最低利润或增长目标

Outflow: depreciation = capital / capital lifetime

支出：折旧 = 资本 / 资本寿命

Converters: capital lifetime = 20

转换器：资本寿命 = 20

growth goal = capital × 10%

增长目标 = 资本 × 10%

profit = ( price × harvest ) – capital

利润 = (价格 × 产量) – 资本

price starts at 1.2 when yield per unit capital is high and rises to 10 as

当单位资本收益率较高时，价格从 1.2 起，随着收益率的增加而上升至 10。

yield per unit capital falls. This is the same nonlinear relationship for

单位资本收益率下降。这与非线性关系相同。

price and yield as in the previous model.

价格和收益率与之前的模型相同。

regeneration rate is 0 when the resource is either fully stocked or
当资源完全储备时，再生率为 0；
completely depleted. In the middle of the resource range, regeneration rate peaks near 0.5.
完全耗尽。在资源范围的中部，再生率峰值接近 0.5。

yield per unit capital starts at 1 when the resource is fully stocked, but falls (non-linearly) as the resource stock declines. Yield per unit capital increases overall from least efficient in Figure 43, to slightly more efficient in Figure 44, to most efficient in Figure 45.

单位资本收益率在资源充足时为1，但随着资源存量的减少而（非线性地）下降。单位资本收益率总体上从图43中的最低效率，到图44中的略微提高，再到图45中的最高效率逐渐增加。

#↩

Notes

笔记

_____________

Introduction

介绍

1 . Russell Ackoff, “The Future of Operational Research Is Past,” Journal of the Operational Research Society 30, no. 2 (February 1979): 93–104.

1. Russell Ackoff，“运筹学的未来已成过去”，运筹学学会杂志 30，第 2 期（1979 年 2 月）：93-104。

2 . Idries Shah, Tales of the Dervishes (New York: E. P. Dutton, 1970), 25.

2. Idries Shah，《苦行僧的故事》（纽约：E. P. Dutton，1970 年），第 25 页。

Chapter One

第一章

1 . Poul Anderson, quoted in Arthur Koestler, The Ghost in the Machine (New York: Macmillan, 1968), 59.

1. Poul Anderson，引自 Arthur Koestler，《机器中的幽灵》（纽约：麦克米伦出版社，1968 年），第 59 页。

2 . Ramon Margalef, “Perspectives in Ecological Theory,” Co-Evolution Quarterly (Summer 1975), 49.

2. Ramon Margalef，“生态理论的视角”，《共同进化季刊》（1975 年夏季），49。

3 . Jay W. Forrester, Industrial Dynamics (Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press, 1961), 15.

3. Jay W. Forrester，《工业动力学》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，1961 年），第 15 页。

4 . Honoré Balzac, quoted in George P. Richardson, Feedback Thought in Social Science and Systems Theory (Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 1991), 54.

4. Honoré Balzac，引自 George P. Richardson，《社会科学和系统理论中的反馈思想》（费城：宾夕法尼亚大学出版社，1991 年），第 54 页。

5 . Jan Tinbergen, quoted in ibid, 44.

5. Jan Tinbergen，引自同上，第 44 页。

Chapter Two

第二章

1 . Albert Einstein, “On the Method of Theoretical Physics,” The Herbert Spencer Lecture, delivered at Oxford (10 June 1933); also published in Philosophy of Science 1, no. 2 (April 1934): 163–69.

1. 阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦，“论理论物理学的方法”，赫伯特·斯宾塞讲座，于1933年6月10日在牛津大学发表；也发表于《科学哲学》1，第2期（1934年4月）：163-169。

2 . The concept of a “systems zoo” was invented by Prof. Hartmut Bossel of the University of Kassel in Germany. His three recent “System Zoo” books contain system descriptions and simulation-model documentations of more than 100 “animals,” some of which are included in modified form here. Hartmut Bossel, System Zoo Simulation Models – Vol. 1: Elementary Systems, Physics, Engineering; Vol. 2: Climate, Ecosystems, Resources; Vol. 3: Economy, Society, Development. (Norderstedt, Germany: Books on Demand, 2007).

2. “系统动物园”的概念由德国卡塞尔大学的哈特穆特·博塞尔教授提出。他最近出版的三本“系统动物园”系列书籍包含了100多种“动物”（系统）的系统描述和仿真模型文档，其中一些内容经过修改后收录于此。哈特穆特·博塞尔，《系统动物园仿真模型——第一卷：基本系统、物理、工程；第二卷：气候、生态系统、资源；第三卷：经济、社会、发展》（德国诺德施泰特：按需印刷出版社，2007年）。

3 . For a more complete model, see the chapter “Population Sector” in Dennis L. Meadows et al., Dynamics of Growth in a Finite World, (Cambridge MA: Wright-Allen Press, 1974).

3. 有关更完整的模型，请参阅 Dennis L. Meadows 等人所著《有限世界中的增长动力学》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：Wright-Allen 出版社，1974 年）中的“人口部门”一章。

4 . For an example, see Chapter 2 in Donella Meadows, Jørgen Randers, and Dennis Meadows, Limits to Growth: The 30-Year Update (White River Junction, VT: Chelsea Green Publishing Co., 2004).

4. 例如，请参阅 Donella Meadows、Jørgen Randers 和 Dennis Meadows 合著的《增长的极限：30 年更新》（佛蒙特州白河交界处：Chelsea Green 出版公司，2004 年）第 2 章。

5 . Jay W. Forrester, 1989. “The System Dynamics National Model: Macrobehavior from Microstructure,” in P. M. Milling and E. O. K. Zahn, eds., Computer-Based Management of Complex Systems: International System Dynamics Conference (Berlin: Springer-Verlag, 1989).

5. Jay W. Forrester，1989 年。“系统动力学国家模型：从微观结构看宏观行为”，载于 P. M. Milling 和 E. O. K. Zahn 编，《复杂系统的计算机化管理：国际系统动力学会议》（柏林：Springer-Verlag，1989 年）。

Chapter Three

第三章

1 . Aldo Leopold, Round River (New York: Oxford University Press, 1993).

1. Aldo Leopold，《圆河》（纽约：牛津大学出版社，1993 年）。

2 . C. S. Holling, ed., Adaptive Environmental Assessment and Management , (Chichester UK: John Wiley & Sons, 1978), 34.

2. C. S. Holling 编，《适应性环境评估与管理》（英国奇切斯特：John Wiley & Sons 出版社，1978 年），第 34 页。

3 . Ludwig von Bertalanffy, Problems of Life: An Evaluation of Modern Biological Thought (New York: John Wiley & Sons Inc., 1952), 105.

3. Ludwig von Bertalanffy，《生命问题：对现代生物学思想的评价》（纽约：John Wiley & Sons Inc.，1952 年），第 105 页。

4 . Jonathan Swift, “Poetry, a Rhapsody, 1733.” In The Poetical Works of Jonathan Swift (Boston: Little Brown & Co.,1959).

4. 乔纳森·斯威夫特，《诗歌狂想曲，1733》。载于《乔纳森·斯威夫特诗集》（波士顿：Little Brown & Co.，1959）。

5 . Paraphrased from Herbert Simon, The Sciences of the Artificial (Cambridge MA: MIT Press, 1969), 90–91 and 98–99.

5. 改编自赫伯特·西蒙的《人工科学》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，1969 年），第 90-91 页和第 98-99 页。

Chapter Four

第四章

1 . Wendell Berry, Standing by Words (Washington, DC: Shoemaker & Hoard, 2005), 65.

1. Wendell Berry，《坚持言辞》（华盛顿特区：Shoemaker & Hoard，2005 年），第 65 页。

2 . Kenneth Boulding, “General Systems as a Point of View,” in Mihajlo D. Mesarovic, ed., Views on General Systems Theory , proceedings of the Second Systems Symposium, Case Institute of Technology, Cleveland, April 1963 (New York: John Wiley & Sons, 1964).

2. Kenneth Boulding，“一般系统作为一种观点”，载于 Mihajlo D. Mesarovic 编，《一般系统理论观点》，第二届系统研讨会论文集，凯斯理工学院，克利夫兰，1963 年 4 月（纽约：John Wiley & Sons，1964 年）。

3 . James Gleick, Chaos: Making a New Science (New York: Viking, 1987), 23–24.

3. James Gleick，《混沌：创造一门新科学》（纽约：Viking出版社，1987年），第23-24页。

4 . This story is compiled from the following sources: C. S. Holling, “The Curious Behavior of Complex Systems: Lessons from Ecology,” in H. A. Linstone, Future Research (Reading, MA: Addison-Wesley, 1977); B. A. Montgomery et al., The Spruce Budworm Handbook , Michigan Cooperative Forest Pest Management Program, Handbook 82-7, November, 1982; The Research News , University of Michigan, April June, 1984; Kari Lie, “The Spruce Budworm Controversy in New Brunswick and Nova Scotia,” Alternatives 10, no. 10 (Spring 1980), 5; R. F. Morris, “The Dynamics of Epidemic Spruce Budworm Populations,” Entomological Society of Canada , no. 31, (1963).

4. 本文内容汇编自以下资料：C. S. Holling，“复杂系统的奇特行为：来自生态学的教训”，载于 H. A. Linstone，《未来研究》（马萨诸塞州雷丁：Addison-Wesley，1977 年）；B. A. Montgomery 等，《云杉芽虫手册》，密歇根州合作森林害虫管理计划，手册 82-7，1982 年 11 月；《研究新闻》，密歇根大学，1984 年 4 月至 6 月；Kari Lie，“新不伦瑞克省和新斯科舍省的云杉芽虫争议”，《替代方案》10，第 10 期（1980 年春季），第 5 页；R. F. Morris，“流行性云杉芽虫种群的动态”，加拿大昆虫学会，第 31 期，（1963 年）。

5 . Garrett Hardin, “The Cybernetics of Competition: A Biologist’s View of Society,” Perspectives in Biology and Medicine 7, no. 1 (1963): 58-84.

5. Garrett Hardin，“竞争的控制论：生物学家对社会的看法”，《生物学和医学展望》7，第 1 期（1963 年）：58-84。

6 . Jay W. Forrester, Urban Dynamics (Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press, 1969), 117.

6. Jay W. Forrester，《城市动力学》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，1969 年），第 117 页。

7 . Václav Havel, from a speech to the Institute of France, quoted in the International Herald Tribune , November 13, 1992, p. 7.

7. 瓦茨拉夫·哈维尔在法兰西学院的演讲，引自《国际先驱论坛报》，1992 年 11 月 13 日，第 7 页。

8 . Dennis L. Meadows, Dynamics of Commodity Production Cycles, ( Cambridge MA: Wright-Allen Press, Inc., 1970).

8. Dennis L. Meadows，《商品生产周期的动态》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：Wright-Allen出版社，1970年）。

9 . Adam Smith, An Inquiry into the Nature and Causes of the Wealth of Nations, Edwin Cannan, ed., (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1976), 477-8.

9.亚当·斯密，《国富论》，埃德温·坎南编，（芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社，1976 年），477-8。

10 . Herman Daly, ed., Toward a Steady-State Economy (San Francisco: W. H. Freeman and Co., 1973), 17; Herbert Simon, “Theories of Bounded Rationality,” in R. Radner and C. B. McGuire, eds., Decision and Organization (Amsterdam: North-Holland Pub. Co., 1972).

10. Herman Daly 编，《迈向稳态经济》（旧金山：W. H. Freeman and Co.，1973 年），第 17 页；Herbert Simon，“有限理性理论”，载于 R. Radner 和 C. B. McGuire 编，《决策与组织》（阿姆斯特丹：North-Holland Pub. Co.，1972 年）。

11 . The term “satisficing” (a merging of “satisfy” and “suffice”) was first used by Herbert Simon to describe the behavior of making decisions that meet needs adequately, rather than trying to maximize outcomes in the face of imperfect information. H. Simon, Models of Man , (New York: Wiley, 1957).

11. “满意原则”（由“满足”和“足够”组合而成）一词最早由赫伯特·西蒙提出，用来描述在信息不完全的情况下，做出能够充分满足需求的决策，而不是试图最大化结果的行为。H. Simon，《人类模型》（纽约：Wiley，1957）。

12 . Philip G. Zimbardo, “On the Ethics of Intervention in Human Psychological Research: With Special Reference to the Stanford Prison Experiment,” Cognition 2, no. 2 (1973): 243–56)

12. Philip G. Zimbardo，“论人类心理学研究中干预的伦理：以斯坦福监狱实验为例”，《认知》2，第2期（1973年）：243-56）

13 . This story was told to me during a conference in Kollekolle, Denmark, in 1973.

13. 这个故事是我在 1973 年于丹麦科勒科勒举行的一次会议上听到的。

第五章

1 . Paraphrased in an interview by Barry James, “Voltaire’s Legacy: The Cult of the Systems Man,” International Herald Tribune , December 16, 1992, p. 24.

10 . See Jonathan Kozol, Savage Inequalities: Children in America’s Schools (New York: Crown Publishers, 1991).

10.参见乔纳森·科佐尔，《残酷的不平等：美国学校里的孩子们》（纽约：皇冠出版社，1991年）。

11. 引自托马斯·L·弗里德曼，《比尔·克林顿现场秀：不仅仅是一场脱口秀》，《国际先驱论坛报》，1992 年 12 月 16 日，第 6 页。

Chapter Six

第六章

1 . Lawrence Malkin, “IBM Slashes Spending for Research in New Cutback,” International Herald Tribune, December 16, 1992, p. 1.

1. Lawrence Malkin，“IBM 大幅削减研发支出”，《国际先驱论坛报》，1992 年 12 月 16 日，第 1 页。

2 . J. W. Forrester, World Dynamics (Cambridge MA: Wright-Allen Press, 1971).

2. J. W. Forrester，《世界动力学》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：Wright-Allen出版社，1971年）。

3 . Forrester, Urban Dynamics (Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press, 1969), 65.

3. Forrester，《城市动力学》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，1969 年），第 65 页。

4 . Thanks to David Holmstrom of Santiago, Chile.

4. 感谢智利圣地亚哥的大卫·霍尔姆斯特罗姆。

5 . For an example, see Dennis Meadows’s model of commodity price fluctuations: Dennis L. Meadows, Dynamics of Commodity Production Cycles (Cambridge, MA: Wright-Allen Press, Inc., 1970).

5. 例如，请参阅丹尼斯·梅多斯的商品价格波动模型：丹尼斯·L·梅多斯，《商品生产周期的动态》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：赖特-艾伦出版社，1970 年）。

6 . John Kenneth Galbraith, The New Industrial State (Boston: Houghton Mifflin, 1967).

6. 约翰·肯尼斯·加尔布雷思，《新工业国家》（波士顿：霍顿·米夫林出版社，1967 年）。

7. 拉尔夫·沃尔多·爱默生，《战争》，1838 年 3 月在波士顿发表的演讲。转载于《爱默生全集》第十一卷（波士顿：霍顿·米夫林公司，1887 年），第 177 页。

Chapter Seven

第七章

1 . G.K. Chesterton, Orthodoxy (New York: Dodd, Mead and Co., 1927).

1. G.K. 切斯特顿，《正统》（纽约：多德、米德公司，1927 年）。

2 . For a beautiful example of how systems thinking and other human qualities can be combined in the context of corporate management, see Peter Senge’s book The Fifth Discipline: The Art and Practice of the Learning Organization (New York: Doubleday, 1990).

2. 要了解系统思维和其他人类特质如何在企业管理中结合起来的一个绝妙例子，请参阅彼得·圣吉的著作《第五项修炼：学习型组织的艺术与实践》（纽约：Doubleday出版社，1990年）。

3 . Philip Abelson, “Major Changes in the Chemical Industry,” Science 255, no. 5051 (20 March 1992), 1489.

3. Philip Abelson，“化学工业的重大变革”，《科学》255，第 5051 期（1992 年 3 月 20 日），1489。

4 . Fred Kofman, “Double-Loop Accounting: A Language for the Learning Organization,” The Systems Thinker 3, no. 1 (February 1992).

4. Fred Kofman，“双环会计：学习型组织的语言”，《系统思考者》3，第 1 期（1992 年 2 月）。

5 . Wendell Berry, Standing by Words (San Francisco: North Point Press, 1983), 24, 52.

5. Wendell Berry，《坚持言辞》（旧金山：北角出版社，1983 年），第 24、52 页。

6 . This story was told to me by Ed Roberts of Pugh-Roberts Associates.

6. 这个故事是 Pugh-Roberts Associates 的 Ed Roberts 告诉我的。

7 . Garrett Hardin, Exploring New Ethics for Survival: the Voyage of the Spaceship Beagle (New York, Penguin Books, 1976), 107.

7. Garrett Hardin，《探索新的生存伦理：贝格尔号宇宙飞船的航行》（纽约，企鹅出版社，1976 年），第 107 页。

8 . Donald N. Michael, “Competences and Compassion in an Age of Uncertainty,” World Future Society Bulletin (January/February 1983).

8. Donald N. Michael，“不确定时代的胜任力和同情心”，世界未来学会公报（1983 年 1 月/2 月）。

9 . Donald N. Michael quoted in H. A. Linstone and W. H. C. Simmonds. eds., Futures Research (Reading, MA: Addison-Wesley, 1977), 98–99.

9. Donald N. Michael 引自 H. A. Linstone 和 W. H. C. Simmonds 编，《未来研究》（马萨诸塞州雷丁：Addison-Wesley，1977 年），第 98-99 页。

10. 奥尔多·利奥波德，《沙乡年鉴及随笔集》（纽约：牛津大学出版社，1968 年），第 224-225 页。

11. Kenneth Boulding，“即将到来的地球飞船的经济学”，载于 H. Jarrett 编，《经济增长中的环境质量：第六届未来资源论坛论文集》（马里兰州巴尔的摩：约翰·霍普金斯大学出版社，1966 年），第 11-12 页。

12. Joseph Wood Krutch，《人性与人类状况》（纽约：兰登书屋，1959 年）。

#↩

Bibliography of Systems Resources

系统资源书目

_____________

In addition to the works cited in the Notes, the items listed here are jumping off points—places to start your search for more ways to see and learn about systems. The fields of systems thinking and system dynamics are now extensive, reaching into many disciplines. For more resources, see also www.ThinkingInSystems.org

除了注释中引用的著作外，此处列出的内容也仅是一些切入点——您可以从这些切入点开始，探索更多理解和学习系统的方法。系统思维和系统动力学领域如今已十分广泛，涵盖众多学科。更多资源，请访问 www.ThinkingInSystems.org

Systems Thinking and Modeling

系统思维与建模

Books

图书

Bossel, Hartmut. Systems and Models: Complexity, Dynamics, Evolution, Sustainability . (Norderstedt, Germany: Books on Demand, 2007). A comprehensive textbook presenting the fundamental concepts and approaches for understanding and modeling the complex systems shaping the dynamics of our world, with a large bibliography on systems.

博塞尔，哈特穆特。《系统与模型：复杂性、动力学、演化、可持续性》（德国诺德施泰特：按需印刷，2007 年）。这是一本全面的教科书，介绍了理解和建模塑造我们世界动态的复杂系统的基本概念和方法，并附有大量关于系统的参考书目。

Bossel, Hartmut. System Zoo Simulation Models . Vol. 1: Elementary Systems, Physics, Engineering ; Vol. 2: Climate, Ecosystems, Resources ; Vol. 3: Economy, Society, Development . (Norderstedt, Germany: Books on Demand, 2007). A collection of more than 100 simulation models of dynamic systems from all fields of science, with full documentation of models, results, exercises, and free simulation model download.

博塞尔，哈特穆特。《系统动物园仿真模型》。第1卷：基本系统、物理、工程；第2卷：气候、生态系统、资源；第3卷：经济、社会、发展。（德国诺德施泰特：按需印刷出版社，2007年）。本书收录了来自各个科学领域的100多个动态系统仿真模型，并附有完整的模型文档、结果、练习题以及免费仿真模型下载。

Forrester, Jay. Principles of Systems . (Cambridge, MA: Pegasus Communications, 1990). First published in 1968, this is the original introductory text on system dynamics.

福雷斯特，杰伊。《系统原理》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：飞马通讯出版社，1990 年）。本书于 1968 年首次出版，是系统动力学的原始入门教材。

Laszlo, Ervin. A Systems View of the World . (Cresskill, NJ: Hampton Press, 1996).

拉斯洛，埃尔文。《世界系统观》（新泽西州克雷斯基尔：汉普顿出版社，1996 年）。

Richardson, George P. Feedback Thought in Social Science and Systems Theory . (Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 1991). The long, varied, and fascinating history of feedback concepts in social theory.

Richardson, George P.《社会科学和系统理论中的反馈思想》（费城：宾夕法尼亚大学出版社，1991 年）。社会理论中反馈概念漫长、多样且引人入胜的历史。

Sweeney, Linda B. and Dennis Meadows. The Systems Thinking Playbook. (2001). A collection of 30 short gaming exercises that illustrate lessons about systems thinking and mental models.

Sweeney, Linda B. 和 Dennis Meadows。《系统思考手册》（2001 年）。这是一本包含 30 个简短游戏练习的合集，用以说明系统思考和心智模型的相关课程。

Organizations, Websites, Periodicals, and Software

组织、网站、期刊和软件

Creative Learning Exchange—an organization devoted to developing “systems citizens” in K–12 education. Publisher of The CLE Newsletter and books for teachers and students. www.clexchange.org isee systems, inc.—Developer of STELLA and iThink software for modeling dynamic systems. www.iseesystems.com

创意学习交流中心（Creative Learning Exchange，简称CLE）——致力于在K-12教育中培养“系统公民”的组织。出版《CLE通讯》以及面向教师和学生的书籍。www.clexchange.org isee systems, inc.——开发用于动态系统建模的STELLA和iThink软件。www.iseesystems.com

Pegasus Communications—Publisher of two newsletters, The Systems Thinker and Leverage Points, as well as many books and other resources on systems thinking. www.pegasuscom.com

Pegasus Communications——出版两份通讯刊物：《系统思考者》和《杠杆点》，以及众多关于系统思考的书籍和其他资源。www.pegasuscom.com

System Dynamics Society—an international forum for researchers, educators, consultants, and practitioners dedicated to the development and use of systems thinking and system dynamics around the world. The Systems Dynamics Review is the official journal of the System Dynamics Society. www.systemdynamics.org

系统动力学学会是一个国际论坛，汇聚了致力于在全球范围内发展和应用系统思维和系统动力学的研究人员、教育工作者、咨询顾问和实践者。《系统动力学评论》是系统动力学学会的官方期刊。www.systemdynamics.org

Ventana Systems, Inc.—Developer of Vensim software for modeling dynamic systems. vensim.com

Ventana Systems, Inc.——动态系统建模软件Vensim的开发商。vensim.com

Systems Thinking and Business

系统思维与商业

Senge, Peter. The Fifth Discipline: The Art and Practice of the Learning Organization. (New York: Doubleday, 1990). Systems thinking in a business environment, and also the broader philosophical tools that arise from and complement systems thinking, such as mental-model flexibility and visioning.

圣吉，彼得。《第五项修炼：学习型组织的艺术与实践》（纽约：Doubleday出版社，1990年）。本书探讨了商业环境中的系统思维，以及由此产生并补充系统思维的更广泛的哲学工具，例如心智模型灵活性和愿景规划。

Sherwood, Dennis. Seeing the Forest for the Trees: A Manager’s Guide to Applying Systems Thinking. (London: Nicholas Brealey Publishing, 2002).

舍伍德，丹尼斯。《见林不见树：经理人应用系统思维指南》（伦敦：尼古拉斯·布雷利出版社，2002 年）。

Sterman, John D. Business Dynamics: Systems Thinking and Modeling for a Complex World. (Boston: Irwin McGraw Hill, 2000).

Sterman, John D. 商业动力学：复杂世界的系统思考和建模。（波士顿：Irwin McGraw Hill，2000 年）。

Systems Thinking and Environment

系统思维与环境

Ford, Andrew. Modeling the Environment. (Washington, DC: Island Press, 1999.)

福特，安德鲁。《环境建模》（华盛顿特区：岛屿出版社，1999年）。

Systems Thinking, Society, and Social Change

系统思维、社会与社会变革

Macy, Joanna. Mutual Causality in Buddhism and General Systems Theory. (Albany, NY: Stat University of New York Press, 1991).

Macy, Joanna.佛教和一般系统理论中的相互因果关系。(纽约州奥尔巴尼：纽约大学出版社，1991 年)。

Meadows, Donella H. The Global Citizen. (Washington, DC: Island Press, 1991).

Meadows, Donella H.《全球公民》（华盛顿特区：岛屿出版社，1991 年）。

#↩

Editor’s Acknowledgments

编辑致谢

_____________

A great many people have helped bring this book to life. In her original manuscript, Donella (Dana) Meadows extended special thanks to the Balaton Group, the Environmental Systems Analysis Group at Kassel, the Environmental Studies Program at Dartmouth, Ian and Margo Baldwin and Chelsea Green Publishing, Hartmut and Rike Bossel, High Performance Systems (now known as isee systems), and many readers and commentators. She also noted the role of her extended “farm family,” those people who, over the years, lived and worked on her organic farm in Plainfield, New Hampshire.

许多人为本书的出版做出了贡献。在她的原稿中，唐娜拉（达娜）·梅多斯特别感谢了巴拉顿集团、卡塞尔环境系统分析小组、达特茅斯环境研究项目、伊恩和玛戈·鲍德温夫妇、切尔西·格林出版社、哈特穆特和里克·博塞尔夫妇、高性能系统公司（现更名为isee系统公司），以及众多读者和评论者。她还特别感谢了她的“农场大家庭”，多年来，那些在她位于新罕布什尔州普莱恩菲尔德的有机农场生活和工作的人们。

As the editor who readied Dana’s manuscript for publication after her death, I would like to add more thanks: Ann and Hans Zulliger and the Foundation for the Third Millennium, along with the board and staff of the Sustainability Institute, have contributed support and enthusiasm to this project. Many advisors and reviewers have critiqued the text and models and helped me think through how to make this book useful to the world—Hartmut Bossel, Tom Fiddaman, Chris Soderquist, Phil Rice, Dennis Meadows, Beth Sawin, Helen Whybrow, Jim Schley, Peter Stein, Bert Cohen, Hunter Lovins, and the students at the Presidio School of Management. The entire team at Chelsea Green Publishing have crafted the complex manuscript into a clear book. I thank all of them for their work to help us be better stewards of our home planet.

作为在达娜去世后负责整理她手稿并最终出版的编辑，我还要特别感谢：安和汉斯·祖利格夫妇、第三千年基金会，以及可持续发展研究所的董事会和全体员工，都为本项目提供了支持和热情。许多顾问和审稿人对文本和模型提出了宝贵的意见，并帮助我思考如何让这本书真正造福世界——他们是：哈特穆特·博塞尔、汤姆·菲达曼、克里斯·索德奎斯特、菲尔·赖斯、丹尼斯·梅多斯、贝丝·索温、海伦·怀布罗、吉姆·施莱、彼得·斯坦、伯特·科恩、亨特·洛文斯，以及普雷西迪奥管理学院的学生们。切尔西·格林出版社的全体成员将这份复杂的手稿精心打磨成一本清晰易懂的书籍。我衷心感谢他们为帮助我们更好地守护地球家园所做出的贡献。

And finally, I thank Dana Meadows for all that I have learned from her and through editing this book.

最后，我要感谢达娜·梅多斯，感谢她让我学到的一切，也感谢她让我有机会编辑这本书。

#↩

About the Author

作者简介

_____________

Donella Meadows (1941–2001) was a scientist trained in chemistry and biophysics (Ph.D., Harvard University). In 1970, she joined the Massachusetts Institute of Technology team lead by Dennis Meadows that produced “World3,” a global computer model that explores the dynamics of human population and economic growth on a finite planet. In 1972, she was lead author of The Limits to Growth, the book that described for the general public the insights from the World3 modeling project. Limits was translated into twenty-eight languages and sparked debate around the world about the earth’s carrying capacity and human choices. Meadows went on to write nine more books on global modeling and sustainable development and for fifteen years she wrote a weekly column, “The Global Citizen,” reflecting on the state of our society and the complex connections in the world.

唐娜·梅多斯（1941-2001）是一位接受过化学和生物物理学训练的科学家（哈佛大学博士）。1970年，她加入由丹尼斯·梅多斯领导的麻省理工学院团队，参与开发了“World3”——一个探索有限地球资源下人口和经济增长动态的全球计算机模型。1972年，她作为主要作者撰写了《增长的极限》一书，向公众阐释了World3建模项目的洞见。该书被翻译成28种语言，并在世界范围内引发了关于地球承载力和人类选择的辩论。此后，梅多斯又撰写了9本关于全球建模和可持续发展的著作，并在长达15年的时间里，每周撰写专栏文章“全球公民”，反思我们社会的现状以及世界错综复杂的相互联系。

In 1991, Meadows was recognized as a Pew Scholar in Conservation and the Environment, and in 1994 she received a MacArthur Fellowship. She founded the Sustainability Institute in 1996 to apply systems thinking and organizational learning to economic, environmental, and social challenges. From 1972 until her death in 2001, Meadows taught in the Environmental Studies Program of Dartmouth College.

1991年，梅多斯荣获皮尤自然保护与环境学者称号；1994年，她获得麦克阿瑟奖。1996年，她创立了可持续发展研究所，致力于运用系统思维和组织学习方法应对经济、环境和社会挑战。从1972年到2001年去世，梅多斯一直在达特茅斯学院环境研究项目任教。

the politics and practice of sustainable living

可持续生活的政治与实践

CHELSEA GREEN PUBLISHING

切尔西·格林出版社

Chelsea Green Publishing sees books as tools for effecting cultural change and seeks to empower citizens to participate in reclaiming our global commons and become its impassioned stewards. If you enjoyed Thinking in Systems , please consider these other great books addressing the complexities of the global society and planet that we all share.

切尔西·格林出版社将书籍视为促成文化变革的工具，致力于赋能公民参与重塑全球公共资源，并成为其充满热情的守护者。如果您喜欢《系统思考》，也请阅读以下这些探讨我们共同拥有的全球社会和地球复杂性的优秀书籍。
